nodes.text: Duke Solha was a human male native to the planet of Serenno. He was dispatched by Count Dooku to the planet Mokivj along with his brother and sister, where he mined cortosis, a rare metal that blocked lightsabers. He established a droid factory, where he made battle droids armored in cortosis. He was foiled by Jedi Knight Anakin Skywalker and the Chiss Commander Thrawn. With Solha's defeat, his entire career would permanently be destroyed by this devastating failure.

Born and native to the planet of Serenno, Duke Solha had a brother and sister. Before the Clone Wars, Solha served in the Galactic Republic, before losing faith in the Republic and joined Count Dooku's new rising faction.

When Count Dooku received vital information from an unknown species. The information explained of a rare metal that could resist lightsabers. Dooku, who was pleased made contact with his master, Darth Sidious and told him of this discovery. Sidious personally wanted clone trooper armor to be made for Order 66, a plot to destroy the Jedi and make a new order. Dooku would dispatch Solha and his brother and sister to Mokivj to oversee operations of mining, and manufacturing.

With the droid factory established, as well as the mines, Solha spent several months processing cortosis and battle droids. It was until, when he had a slight encounter with Duja, former handmaiden of Padmé Amidala. Duja would be dealt with by assassins as ordered by Solha, who left her corpse at a bar, Padmé would eventually receive the call from Duja and her findings. Padmé would eventually go missing for months. This led her husband, Jedi Knight Anakin Skywalker to go searching for his lost wife. His search would lead him to Batuu, where he discovered a ship. He would meet Commander Mitth'raw'nuruodo of the Chiss Expansionary Defense Fleet. Eventually, Thrawn and Anakin's search would led them to Mokivj, where Solha was.
Solha wore a Serennian cloak, and later wore clone trooper armor with cortosis on it while fighting Anakin Skywalker.
Solha first appeared as the secondary antagonist in the 2018 novel Thrawn: Alliances by Timothy Zahn.
